segments.text: I see the woman standing at the sink, completely absorbed in drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but notice how the water is pouring over the edge of the sink, creating a growing puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way she seems so unaware of the chaos around her is surprising.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It feels like she’s in a world of her own, focused solely on her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish she would look down; the water could damage the cabinets, and she might slip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is reaching for those cookies, and I can’t believe how precarious it looks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His body stretches in such an awkward way, and I feel a knot tighten in my stomach.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him, her arm raised and waiting, just seems so innocent yet complicit.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their little scheme is cute but also a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I imagine the crash that could happen in just a moment if he tips over.
segments.speaker: PAR
